comment: Emily's voice made me feel something I haven't in years. You can feel the power, you can sense the emotion. It was a flashback to the first time I listened LP in 2006.

At first I can't accept the fact that LP has a new vocalist. Months goes by I starting to like it now. True, Chester is irreplaceable, this is the new Linkin Park.

I'm deeply moved by 'Emptiness Machine'. The new vocalist has brought a unique energy, keeping the spirit of Linkin Park alive. As a long-time fan, I feel the band's legacy is in good hands and will continue to be respected and cherished. Thank you for giving us this renewed hope. You've truly been a part of my life.
The goosebumps when she gets that shout with high notes...

The band wasn‚Äôt just only about Chester, it was about everyone involved.
Was I the only one who cried when they played again? That mix of joy, nostalgia, and emotion just hit so hard.
All the haters out there dissing Emily can stfu forever. Of course she‚Äôs not Chester, but she brings a fresh voice, that crazy energy, and emotional pull that Linkin Park brought in the past.

To be honest, I am actually very attached to the "old" Linkin Park, but now, for what happened we are talking about history. In any case, the new singer, Emily, in my opinion identifies a new direction for the band; reborn after her arrival. Her tones and her grit are very reminiscent of Chester, in fact in many expressions she emphasizes them. Compared to an animal, she would be a lioness. The band now has to focus on the new direction, unfortunately the old songs, especially those from the first albums, before Emily, sound decidedly strange. Good luck to the new Linkin Park! I am and will always be with them.
